# URLS

## Types Of URLs

### 1. Sites Browser Resolving Types Of References

    1.1. Reference By URL
    
    1.2. Hardcoded Resources Contents Base64 Encoded



### 2. Webpack and @jaisocx/css-importer @Aliases Resolving Types

    2.1. To Include Hardcoded
    
    2.2. Resolve Reference By URL Relative To The Produced `bundle.js`



### 3. Addressing Types of URLs

    3.1. Relative
    
    3.2. Absolute
    
       3.2.1. Slash Started
    
       3.2.2. Protocol and Domain Started



## Resolving Relative URLs

When Chrome obtains a resource from an HTTPS server,
it resolves relative URLs differently depending on
the context:

### 1. In HTML Pages

- For URLs in HTML files:
  Relative URLs are resolved relative to the HTML file's location


### 1. In CSS Stylesheets

- For URLs in CSS files:
  If the CSS was loaded
  via a relative URL in the HTML page,
  then the relative URLs within the CSS are
  resolved relative to the CSS file's location



### Sites Server Response Headers

1.  Origin

The Origin header typically contains:

- The protocol (https://)
- The hostname (domain.com)
- The port number if not default (e.g. :443)

Example: https://domain.com




2.  Referrer





## Types Of URLs Examples

### 1. Sites Browser Resolving Types Of References

#### 1.1. Reference By URL

**Few Examples**

Hyperlink

.html
```html
<a href="example.html">Navigates To example.html</a>
```

Other stylesheet

.html
```html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css" />
```

.css
```css
@import url("style.css");
```

Font

.html
```html
<link rel="preload" as="font" href="font.ttf" />
```

.css
```css
@font-face { font-name: Font; src: url("font.ttf"); }
```


Image

.html
```html
<img src="image.webp" />
```

.css
```css
background-image: url("image.webp");
```



#### 1.2. Hardcoded Resources Contents Base64 Encoded

Format:
```javascript
`data:${MimeType};base64,${Base64Encoded_Image}`
```


**Few Examples**

Image

![House](data:image/png;base64,)

.html
```html
  <img src="data:image/png;base64," />
```

.css
```css
  background-image: url("data:image/png;base64,");
```




### 2. Webpack and @jaisocx/css-importer @Aliases Resolving Types

#### 2.1. To Include Hardcoded

.css
```css
@import url("@MediaAndStyles/style.css");
```



#### 2.2. Resolve Reference By URL Relative To The Produced `bundle.js`

.css
```css
@font-face { font-name: Font; src: url("font.ttf"); }
```



### 3. Addressing Types of URLs

#### 3.1. Relative URL

Image

.html
```html
<img src="image.webp" />
```

.html
```html
<img src="../../images/image.webp" />
```

.html
```html
<img src="images/mini-images/mime-types/mini-image-mime-type-MS_Excel.png" />
```


#### 3.2. Absolute URL

##### 3.2.1. Slash Started Absolute URL

Image

.html
```html
<img src="/mini-images/mime-types/mini-image-mime-type-MS_Excel.png" />
```


##### 3.2.2. Protocol and Domain Started Absolute URL

Image

.html
```html
<img src="https://images.cdn.company.com/mini-images/mime-types/mini-image-mime-type-MS_Excel.png" />
```
